info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Berks and central Lehigh Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fleetwood, or 10 miles northeast of Reading, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Emmaus, Kutztown, Fleetwood, Topton, Shoemakersville, Lyons, Lenhartsville, New Tripoli, Zionsville, Jordan Valley, Ancient Oaks, Claussville, Schnecksville, Macungie and Alburtis. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 46 and 59. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 37 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
